Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Tactics \Tac"tics\, n. [Gr. ?, pl., and ? (sc. ?, sing., fr. ? fit for ordering or arranging, fr. ?, ?, to put in order, to arrange: cf. F. tactique.] 1. The science and art of disposing military and naval forces in order for battle, and performing military and naval evolutions. It is divided into grand tactics, or the tactics of battles, and elementary tactics, or the tactics of instruction. [1913 Webster]
2. Hence, any system or method of procedure. [1913 Webster]
tactics n : the branch of military science dealing with detailed maneuvers to achieve objectives set by strategy
